alert.note: Alert for Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:32PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central St. Tammany, southeastern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and west central Pearl River Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bush, or 12 miles west of Picayune, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Covington, Abita Springs, Madisonville, Sun and Bush. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 59 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany; Washington
